data.title: Bruce Pirie - 2014 - Men's Lacrosse
data.meta_description: Bruce Pirie (27) M  -  As a senior: Appeared in 17-of-21 games in the defensive midfield in 2014 ... Picked up three ground balls on the year while adding a caused
data.text:
As a senior: Appeared in 17-of-21 games in the defensive midfield in 2014 ... Picked up three ground balls on the year while adding a caused turnover at second-seeded and fourth-ranked Syracuse in the Bulldogs' NCAA First Round win May 11.

As a junior: Saw action against Wagner on April 13, recording a pair of ground balls and going 3-for-3 at the faceoff X.

As a sophomore: Redshirted the 2012 season.

As a freshman: Appeared in 10 games in his first season with the Black and Gold ... Collected three ground balls and went 5-of-9 in faceoffs ... Won each of his first three collegiate faceoffs against Saint Joseph's (Feb. 19), Army (Mar. 11) and Providence (Mar. 22) ... Took a season-high four faceoffs against Mount St. Mary's on Apr. 30.

Before Bryant: A 2010 graduate of Indian Hills High School, where he was a four-year varsity letterwinner and starting midfielder ... Led team to four-straight New Jersey state tournament appearances and a league title as a sophomore ... Set a new single-season record for faceoff wins as a senior in 2010 (283) ... Set a new record for career faceoff wins ... Two-time first team all-league selection (2009 and 2010) ... Second team all-suburban honors as a senior ... Second team all-league pick as a sophomore ... Also a three-year varsity football letterwinner, where he earned a second team all-league selection as a junior ... Two-sport captain as a senior ... Earned a varsity letter in basketball as a senior as well.

Personal: The son of Rob and Ginny Pirie, Robert Bruce Pirie was born September 2, 1992 ... Has one sister, Rebecca ... Cousin Michael Burns plays lacrosse for North Carolina.
